{{cpp/io/basic_istream/title|putback}}
{{cpp/io/basic_istream/navbar}}
{{ddcl|
basic_istream&amp; putback( char_type ch );
}}

Puts the character {{c|ch}} back to the input stream so the next extracted character will be {{c|ch}}. 

First clears {{tt|eofbit}}, then behaves as {{named req|UnformattedInputFunction}}. After constructing and checking the sentry object, if {{ltf|cpp/io/basic_ios/rdbuf}} is not null, calls {{c|rdbuf()-&gt;sputbackc(ch)}}, which calls {{c|rdbuf()-&gt;pbackfail(ch)}} if {{c|ch}} does not equal the most recently extracted character.

If {{tt|rdbuf()}} is null or if {{c|rdbuf-&gt;sputbackc(ch)}} returns {{c|Traits::eof()}}, calls {{c|setstate(badbit)}}.

In any case, sets the {{rlpf|gcount}} counter to zero.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|ch|character to put into input stream}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|*this}}

===Exceptions===
{{include|cpp/io/stream_exceptions}}

===Example===
{{example
|Demonstrates the difference between modifying and non-modifying {{tt|putback()}}.
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;
 
int main()
{
    std::stringstream s1("Hello, world"); // IO stream
    s1.get();
    if (s1.putback('Y')) // modifies the buffer
        std::cout &lt;&lt; s1.rdbuf() &lt;&lt; '\n';
    else
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "putback failed\n";

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "--\n";

    std::istringstream s2("Hello, world"); // input-only stream
    s2.get();
    if (s2.putback('Y')) // cannot modify input-only buffer
        std::cout &lt;&lt; s2.rdbuf() &lt;&lt; '\n';
    else
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "putback failed\n"; 
    s2.clear();

    std::cout &lt;&lt; "--\n";

    if (s2.putback('H')) // non-modifying putback
        std::cout &lt;&lt; s2.rdbuf() &lt;&lt; '\n';
    else
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "putback failed\n";
}
|output=
Yello, world
--
putback failed
--
Hello, world
}}
